item.value: The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
In 1972 Ray Tomlinson at BBN developed the first e-mail program. In his first email to himself, he uses the @ sign. This was the first time it appeared in an e-mail address.
Sneezing with your eyes open is impossible
Yuma in the state of Arizona has over 4,000 hours of sunshine per year - making it the sunniest place on the planet. The South Pole is the least sunny place with only 182 days a year off sunshine
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters ( 2,717 ft ) tall.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters. The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in the Japanese island of Okinawa. She died a week before her 115th birthday. She was born on May 10, 1895.
The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. Known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, the quake measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
The heaviest apple weighed 1.849 kg (4 lb 1 oz) and was grown and picked by Chisato Iwasaki at his apple farm in Hirosaki City, Japan October 24, 2005.
